alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 1:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BERNALILLO COUNTY THROUGH 230 PM MDT... At 142 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm over northwestern Albuquerque, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Isleta Pueblo, South Valley, North Valley and Alameda. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 151 and 164. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 210 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
